50 years of Data Science

More than 50 years ago, John Tukey called for a reformation of academic statistics. In recent years, there has been an emergence of Data Science programs at major universities, including UC Berkeley and NYU. These programs have led to a growing phenomenon in the field of Data Science, with some overlap in curricular subject matter with traditional statistics courses.

Key Concepts:

  • The emergence of Data Science as a distinct field
  • The evolution of academic statistics
  • The growing phenomenon of Data Science programs
  • Data Analysis
  • Computing with data
  • Scientific Discovery
  • The impact of big data on job markets
  • The importance of computing and database skills in data science
  • The limitations of traditional statistics degrees in the age of big data
data science statistics academic reform Data Science Acronyms Statistics big data data analysis information technology job market
